intro: Mulgedium lessertianum subsp. dentatum, commonly known as the serrated mulgedium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, serrated leaf margins. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in areas with moderate to high rainfall. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
